3 ^ Deus: 5 ^ Ostendistī populō tuō dūra; pōtāvistī nōs vīnō compūnctiōnis. ^ Thou hast shown thy people hard things; thou hast made us drink the wine of sorrow.

et dēstrūxistī nōs; īrātus es: ut libērentur dīlēctī tuī. ^ Thou hast given a warning to them that fear thee
et misertus es nōbīs. ^ O God: that they may flee from before the bow
thou hast cast us off: that thy beloved may be delivered.

repulistī nōs: et exaudī mē. ^ Save me with thy right hand

3 ^ Deus: 8 ^ Deus locūtus est in sānctō suō: Laetābor
et dēstrūxistī nōs; īrātus es: et convallem tabernāculōrum mētier. ^ God hath spoken in his holy place: I will rejoice
thou hast cast us off: and will mete out the vale of tabernacles.

et dēstrūxistī nōs; īrātus es: et Efraim fortitūdō capitis meī. Jūda rēx meus; ^ Gilead is mine
thou hast cast us off: and Ephraim is the strength of my head. Judah is my king;

3 ^ Deus: 10 ^ Moab olla speī meae. In Idūmaeam extendem calceāmentum meum; mihi aliēnigenae subditī sunt. ^ Moab is the pot of my hope. Into Edom will I stretch out my shoe; to me the foreigners are made subject.
11 ^ Quis dēdūcet mē in cīvitātem mūnītam? Quis dēdūcet mē usque in Idūmaeam? ^ Who will bring me into the strong city? Who will lead me into Edom?

et dēstrūxistī nōs; īrātus es: quī repulistī nōs? Et nōn ēgrediēris Deus in virtūtibus nostrīs? ^ Wilt not thou

repulistī nōs: quia vāna salūs hominis. ^ Give us help from trouble
et dēstrūxistī nōs; īrātus es: for vain is the salvation of man.

repulistī nōs: et ipse ad nihilum dēdūcet trībulantēs nōs. ^ Through God we shall do mightily
et dēstrūxistī nōs; īrātus es: and he shall bring to nothing them that afflict us.
